result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell R Barron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf'r Falsely Present NonDrug as Drug [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court
Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and reimburse City of Whitewater Police Department for "buy money."   
Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No contact with any drug offenders other than through treatment.  No contact with Maxwell McDonald, Nicholas Herrmann, Tyler McGinnis, Kaleb Sperber or Zachary Karow.
----------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------

timeConds.notes: to commence on March 21, 2016. Conditional Jail time may be served in Dane County under electronic monitoring if available to him.
The defendant is to complete a total of twenty (20) hours of community service work WITHOUT buyout option.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell R Barron

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Records sent as requested
Defendant Mitchell R Barron in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
BOND QUASHED

Final pre-trial at 01-28-2016 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person at 02-01-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Mitchell R Barron in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

2:37 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg appears by phone.  
Defendant's appearance was excused for today's status hearing.  
Attorney Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Eisenberg advises that they had agreed to a consolidation on delivery of MDMA which was not expungeable under the statutes.  
The drug, when tested, was not actually MDMA.  The charge has been amended to selling a fake drug which is expungeable.  
DA Necci was not going to agree to expungement.  
The Jefferson County case is set for sentencing on Thursday of this week.  
Attorney Rea indicates that the State's original agreement is no longer in place and the State wishes to proceed with the Walworth County charges here.  
Attorney Eisenberg believes it is going to be a plea and asks that it be placed on the calendar for a change of plea hearing in the next couple of weeks.  
He would then like sentencing put off to a future date with the possibility that they may reach an agreement.  
Court will set a change of plea hearing on a 1:15 Call.  
Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  
2:41 p.m.  Court in recess.
Status conference at 09-08-2015 02:30 pm
Stipulation and Order Consolidating Cases
Subpoena - CI
Subpoena - NWH

Defendant Mitchell R Barron in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's
Defense Motion to File Further Motions After Receipt of Discovery
Defense Motion to Disclose Intent to Use Other Crimes, Wrongs, or Bad Acts
Defense Motion for Exculpatory Evidence
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Not guilty plea and trial reserved.

Defendant Mitchell R Barron in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Mitchell R Barron
Current: 921 Spaight St Apt 1, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 08-28-2014)
Prior: 2980A Waubesa Ave., Madison, WI 53711
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO KNOWING CONTACT WITH CI 815. NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR NICHOLAS HERRMANN.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
